tesamorelin.name: Tesamorelin
tesamorelin.mechanism: Binds to GHRH receptors in the pituitary, stimulating pulsatile GH release that mimics natural secretion patterns
tesamorelin.research_findings: Clinical trials demonstrated 15-20% reduction in trunk fat. FDA-approved for HIV-associated lipodystrophy. Currently being studied for mild cognitive impairment

ipamorelin.name: Ipamorelin
ipamorelin.mechanism: Stimulates GH release via ghrelin receptors (GHS-R1a) without significantly affecting cortisol, prolactin, or aldosterone
ipamorelin.research_findings: One of the most selective secretagogues with minimal side effects. Unlike GHRP-6 or GHRP-2, produces minimal hunger stimulation

bpc157.name: BPC-157
bpc157.mechanism: Upregulates growth hormone receptors, promotes angiogenesis via VEGF pathways, modulates nitric oxide systems, interacts with dopaminergic system
bpc157.research_findings: Derived from human gastric juice. Stable in gastric acid. Direct gut-brain axis modulation. Supports recovery from dopamine-depleting agents
bpc157.special_notes: Best bang-for-buck for longevity, gut health (SIBO), and cognitive enhancement

tb500.name: TB-500
tb500.mechanism: Sequesters G-actin, promoting cell migration and proliferation. Upregulates actin polymerization. Reduces inflammation via NF-κB modulation
tb500.research_findings: 43-amino-acid peptide naturally occurring in most tissues. Research includes cardiac post-MI studies, wound healing, corneal repair

ghkcu.name: GHK-Cu
ghkcu.mechanism: Gene modulation affecting over 4,000 genes. Enhances collagen synthesis, promotes tissue remodeling, antioxidant properties
ghkcu.research_findings: Naturally declines with age. Modulates thousands of genes related to tissue repair and inflammation

motsc.name: MOTS-c
motsc.mechanism: Activates AMPK pathway, regulates metabolic homeostasis, enhances mitochondrial function, improves insulin sensitivity
motsc.research_findings: Encoded in mitochondrial DNA. Acts as exercise mimetic. Research shows metabolic improvements and lifespan extension in animal models

retatrutide.name: Retatrutide
retatrutide.mechanism: Triple agonist of GIP, GLP-1, and glucagon receptors. Comprehensive metabolic regulation
retatrutide.research_findings: Clinical trials showed superior weight loss compared to dual agonists. Phase 3 trials ongoing

pinealon.name: Pinealon
pinealon.mechanism: Epigenetic CNS modulation, neuroprotection, circadian rhythm regulation, melatonin synthesis optimization
pinealon.research_findings: From Khavinson's Russian bioregulator research. Small peptides can cross blood-brain barrier

epitalon.name: Epitalon
epitalon.mechanism: Activates telomerase in somatic cells, stimulates pineal gland function, modulates neuroendocrine system
epitalon.dosing: 5-10mg daily for 10-20 day cycles, 2-3 cycles per year
epitalon.research_findings: Tetrapeptide (Ala-Glu-Asp-Gly) from Khavinson research. Studies showed increased telomerase activity and telomere elongation in human cell cultures. Animal research demonstrated lifespan extension
epitalon.special_notes: Best direct longevity play with telomerase activation data

thymulin.name: Thymulin
thymulin.mechanism: Essential for T-cell differentiation and maturation, modulates cytokine production, influences neuroendocrine-immune communication. Requires zinc cofactor
thymulin.dosing: 1-5mg daily or several times weekly, with zinc supplementation
thymulin.research_findings: Nonapeptide naturally produced by thymic epithelial cells. Levels decrease dramatically with thymic involution, nearly undetectable by age 60

selank.name: Selank
selank.mechanism: Modulates GABA and serotonin systems, influences BDNF expression, immunomodulatory effects
selank.research_findings: Synthetic derivative of tuftsin. Developed in Russia for anxiety disorders without sedation or addiction potential

semax.name: Semax
semax.mechanism: BDNF expression, NGF modulation, dopaminergic and serotonergic system enhancement, neuroprotection
semax.research_findings: ACTH(4-10) analog. Developed in Russia. Well-studied for cognitive enhancement and neuroprotection

kpv.name: KPV
kpv.mechanism: Downregulates NF-κB and MAPK inflammatory signaling pathways. Transported by PepT1 (intestinal peptide transporter) suggesting direct gut tissue uptake
kpv.dosing: 500-1000mcg daily, can be oral or subcutaneous
primary_benefits: Direct gut tissue uptake via PepT1
kpv.research_findings: Tripeptide derived from alpha-MSH. Mouse colitis studies showed anti-inflammatory efficacy. Can be transported directly into gut tissue via peptide transporter PepT1
kpv.special_notes: Particularly valuable for SIBO and inflammatory gut conditions when combined with BPC-157

modgrf129.name: CJC-1295 (Mod GRF 1-29)
modgrf129.mechanism: Modified GHRH (1-29) that stimulates pulsatile GH release. Provides natural GH pulse pattern without continuous elevation
modgrf129.research_findings: Modified growth hormone releasing hormone (also called Mod GRF 1-29). Provides natural pulsatile GH release. Often stacked with Ipamorelin for enhanced GH output. Note: This is WITHOUT DAC (Drug Affinity Complex)
modgrf129.special_notes: Best alternative to Tesamorelin when paired with Ipamorelin. CJC-1295 without DAC allows natural pulsing. Not to be confused with CJC-1295 WITH DAC which has a much longer half-life and continuous GH elevation

pancragen.name: Pancragen
pancragen.mechanism: Bioregulation of pancreatic cells, supports insulin production and beta cell function. Epigenetic modulation specific to pancreatic tissue
pancragen.dosing: 10-20mg daily for 10-20 day cycles, 2-3 cycles per year
pancragen.research_findings: Khavinson bioregulator specific to pancreatic tissue. Part of Russian bioregulator tradition showing organ-specific epigenetic effects. Designed to support pancreatic function and insulin production
pancragen.special_notes: HIGHLY RELEVANT - Directly addresses beta cell support and insulin resistance goals. Pairs excellently with MOTS-c for comprehensive metabolic protocol

cortagen.name: Cortagen
cortagen.mechanism: Bioregulation of cortical neurons, supports synaptic plasticity and brain tissue function. Epigenetic modulation of cerebral cortex
cortagen.dosing: 10-20mg daily for 10-20 day cycles, 2-3 cycles per year
primary_benefits: Recovery from brain injury or stress
cortagen.research_findings: Khavinson bioregulator targeting cerebral cortex. Focus on cognitive performance and cortical neuron health. Complements Pinealon's broader CNS and circadian effects
cortagen.special_notes: Complements Pinealon for comprehensive brain support - Pinealon for circadian/pineal, Cortagen for cognitive performance. Often cycled together

chonluten.name: Chonluten
chonluten.mechanism: Bioregulation of intestinal epithelial cells, specifically targets colon/large intestine tissue. Supports intestinal barrier function
chonluten.dosing: 10-20mg daily for 10-20 day cycles, 2-3 cycles per year
chonluten.research_findings: Khavinson bioregulator specific to large intestine/colon. Part of digestive system bioregulator family. Complements broader gut repair peptides like BPC-157
chonluten.special_notes: Complements BPC-157 for gut healing - BPC-157 is broad-spectrum gut repair, Chonluten is colon-specific bioregulator. Useful for SIBO recovery and lower GI issues

livagen.name: Livagen
livagen.mechanism: Bioregulation of hepatocytes (liver cells). Supports liver function, detoxification, and hepatic tissue regeneration
livagen.dosing: 10-20mg daily for 10-20 day cycles, 2-3 cycles per year
primary_benefits: Protection from toxins and oxidative stress
livagen.research_findings: Khavinson bioregulator for hepatic tissue. Part of metabolic organ support family. Important for overall metabolic health and longevity as liver function is central to metabolism
livagen.special_notes: Pairs excellently with Pancragen for complete metabolic organ support (liver + pancreas). Important for metabolic health and aging

ll37.name: LL-37
ll37.mechanism: Broad-spectrum antimicrobial activity against bacteria, viruses, and fungi. Modulates immune responses, promotes wound healing, and has anti-biofilm properties
ll37.research_findings: Human cathelicidin antimicrobial peptide, part of innate immune system. Shows broad-spectrum antimicrobial activity and wound healing properties. Being studied for chronic wounds, infections, and inflammatory conditions

dsip.name: DSIP
dsip.mechanism: Modulates sleep architecture by enhancing delta wave (slow-wave) sleep. Regulates HPA axis, stress hormones, and circadian rhythms. May have neuroprotective and analgesic properties
dsip.dosing: 100-300mcg before bed or 2-3x daily for stress
primary_benefits: Pain modulation and chronic pain relief
dsip.research_findings: Discovered in 1977 from rabbit brain. Increases slow-wave sleep and modulates HPA axis. Shows promise for stress-related disorders, chronic pain, and insomnia. Some evidence for alcohol/opioid withdrawal support. Exhibits both sedative and stress-protective effects
dsip.special_notes: Unique dual action: promotes sleep but also helps with daytime stress management. Excellent for recovery protocols. Pairs well with Epitalon and Pinealon for comprehensive sleep/circadian support

aod9604.name: AOD-9604
aod9604.mechanism: Fragment 176-191 of human growth hormone. Stimulates lipolysis (fat breakdown) and inhibits lipogenesis (fat formation) without affecting blood sugar or IGF-1 levels
primary_benefits: Enhanced fat loss, especially abdominal fat
No effect on blood sugar or insulin
aod9604.research_findings: Originally developed as anti-obesity drug. Shows selective fat-reducing effects without the growth-promoting or blood sugar effects of full GH. Does not bind to GH receptors. Australian studies showed significant fat loss, particularly visceral fat

kisspeptin.name: Kisspeptin
kisspeptin.mechanism: Binds to GPR54 (KISS1R) receptor to stimulate GnRH secretion. Master regulator of hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal axis. Controls puberty onset and reproductive function
kisspeptin.dosing: Research doses vary, typically 10-100mcg via injection or nasal
primary_benefits: May improve libido and sexual function
Potential cancer suppression properties (KISS1 metastasis suppressor)
kisspeptin.research_findings: Discovered as metastasis suppressor gene product. Critical for puberty initiation and reproductive function. Research ongoing for hypogonadism treatment, infertility, and potential anti-cancer applications. May have roles in energy balance and metabolism
kisspeptin.special_notes: Complex peptide with multiple potential applications beyond reproduction - metabolic effects, cancer research, and possible longevity connections through reproductive hormone modulation

humanin.name: Humanin
humanin.mechanism: 24-amino-acid peptide encoded within mitochondrial 16S rRNA. Binds to specific receptors (formyl peptide receptor-like 1, GP130/WSX-1 complex). Cytoprotective signaling that inhibits apoptosis and oxidative stress
humanin.dosing: Research stage - dosing still being established
humanin.research_findings: Discovered in 2001 during screen for proteins that protect against Alzheimer's-related neuronal death. Humanin levels decline with age. Acts as a cytoprotective factor across multiple cell types. Research shows protection against A-beta toxicity, myocardial ischemia, and other age-related pathologies. May be a key longevity peptide
humanin.special_notes: HIGHLY RELEVANT for longevity - mitochondrial-derived peptide with broad cytoprotective effects. One of the most promising longevity peptides. Levels naturally decline with age. Research stage but highly significant potential

ss31.name: SS-31
ss31.mechanism: Selective mitochondrial targeting via alternating aromatic-cationic residues. Binds to cardiolipin in inner mitochondrial membrane, stabilizing cristae structure and improving electron transport chain efficiency. Reduces mitochondrial ROS production and inhibits mPTP opening
ss31.dosing: Research doses typically 1-10mg daily via subcutaneous injection
primary_benefits: Improves muscle function and exercise capacity
ss31.research_findings: Developed as elamipretide (also known as SS-31 or Bendavia). Phase 2/3 trials for mitochondrial myopathy, primary mitochondrial diseases, and age-related conditions. Shows promise for heart failure, macular degeneration, and neurodegenerative diseases. Improves mitochondrial efficiency and reduces oxidative damage
ss31.special_notes: One of the most clinically advanced mitochondrial peptides. Multiple human trials completed. Particularly promising for age-related mitochondrial decline and cardiovascular conditions. Commercial development ongoing by Stealth BioTherapeutics
